Content: OK so to be clear. If I sweep the paper wallet, the staking rewards will be added to the amount I sweep and both will arrive in the new address.

Content:

https://support.komodoplatform.com/support/solutions/articles/29000026631-sign-transactions-offline-and-broadcast-online-using-agama

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: got it

Author: PacificK2A#4591
Content: Yes yes, I know about offline transactions. I do them with Bitcoin. No problem. But to sweep to the same address. I don't think it is safe.

Author: PacificK2A#4591
Content: When an address is swept, the pay to hash is revealed.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
```

Why address reuse is discouraged:

Reduced security: An unused address is protected by ECDSA AND several SHA-256 and RIPEMD-160 operations, but only ECDSA after being used because the public key must be revealed during spending. This has been shown to open up several possible attacks in the past.[1]

Reduced privacy: All participants who you give the address to know it is yours obviously. They can use this information to analyze incoming and outgoing transactions to identify other addresses you own and who you are interacting with, not to mention how much bitcoin you have. This can be serious for businesses in competition or in situations where a payment might might put someone into harms way (politically unpopular donations or as a means for extortion, etc).
```

Author: PacificK2A#4591
Content: Yes, exactly this is what I said, the pay to hash is revealed "An unused address is protected by ECDSA AND several SHA-256 and RIPEMD-160 operations, but only ECDSA after being used because the public key must be revealed during spending. This has been shown to open up several possible attacks in the past."

for a secure implementation, there is no issue

Author: PacificK2A#4591
Content: Ahhh, so I need to do 2 offline transactions. For example, I offline sweep the address A to the same address A. Then afterwards I create a new address B and sweep again offline from A to B. The staking rewards will then go from A to B along with the funds in A. Correct ?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: see the example sending 0.777 out of 777, the txn will still claim rewards

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: @PacificK2A that works

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
or you can do
A -> B
again A -> B

Author: PacificK2A#4591
Content: wait ? When I do A -> B then what happens to my staking rewards ? Do they show up in A after I have sent to B ?

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
its not really a risk man
the risk was if the implementation of priivkey derivation was unsecure

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
```
Do they show up in A after I have sent to B ?
```
yes

Author: PacificK2A#4591
Content: Ahhhh, OK. Then its easy. I just do two offline transactions from A -> B one after the other. Then there is no risk. 100% safe. Thank you again ! Have a nice day.

Author: PacificK2A#4591
Content: Emmanuel, in my experience in crypto, you must be paranoid. Never give the scammers a chance. Stay safe.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you really need privacy, just use PIRATE

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you really worry about Quantum Computers cracking your privkey... then and only then would you need to be doing claim and send to fresh address every month

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: realistically, the first quantum computers will be going after all the giant amounts of BTC at exchanges and whale wallets

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: after we start hearing of such things, then maybe it is worth going to such levels of security

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: address reuse does give up a bit of privacy, but to pretend that using new addresses each time gives you any privacy at all is nonsense

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you need privacy, PIRATE is the only thing i know that achieves that.

Author: millou#6214
Content: Hi. I have the following issue with Agama wallet. It has painfully downloaded new blocks for 10-12 hours, but it reached 90-95% completion and then it suddenly jumped back to 3% and started doing it all over again. It seems I can't activate best chain.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: @millou OS?

Author: millou#6214
Content: MacOS Mojave

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
can you access this directory: `~/Library/Application Support/Komodo`
@millou ?

Author: millou#6214
Content: Sure

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
```
In ~/Library/Application Support/Komodo
delete the following files/folders

blocks
chainstate
notarisations
komodostate
komodostate.ind
peers.dat

DO NOT delete wallet.dat
back it up

download https://bootstrap.dexstats.info/KMD-bootstrap.tar.gz
extract it into the Komodo directory
```
@millou

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: first close the application

Author: millou#6214
Content: Did that already @gcharang but will try again

Content: @millou confirm you are using the latest release: https://github.com/VerusCoin/Agama/releases/tag/v0.5.7-4

Content: Yes latest version

Author: millou#6214
